extendedInfo.description: The talk.origins archive has a lot of great information, but is rather hard to read on an Android phone due to the sheer volume of content. Topics deal with evolution, creationism, intelligent design, geology, astronomy, atheism, and more.This application features a browser of all claims on the Talk Origins website (http://talkorigins.org/indexcc/list.html). No modifications were made to the content, and it is full property of the Talk Origins site.Features include a browser, favorites list, search, and sharing options.YOU WILL NEED INTERNET ACCESS TO VIEW CLAIMSIcon by http://joshuastuchl.com

reviews.comment: The HTML error has *finally* been fixed. This app is now worth something!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Amazing idea
reviews.comment: That\'s the rating for the app idea and layout. 5 when its more aesthetic.  But it just doesn\'t work consistently. Using a galaxy note on gingerbread 2.3.6 if that info helps in solving this. Get the same HTML errors as everyone else.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t seem to work
reviews.comment: No matter what I do all I get when I go to read an article is an error message saying there was a problem fetching the HTML.   Shame, as this sounds like a very handy application.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sucks
reviews.comment: Nothing but the titles seemed like it could be a good app if it worked at all
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent for Talk Origins on the Go
reviews.comment: Excellent for Talk Origins on the Go
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: They may say this is a pro atheist app, but in reality, its almost pro Christian.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crap
reviews.comment: It won\'t load anything except a blank screen. Devs never update the app. Junk, uninstall.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fantastic idea
reviews.comment: Condensing the sheer amount of information on the TalkOrigins archives into readable panels is brilliant. Very handy to have.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Has Issues on Samsung Galaxy Note w/ICS.
reviews.comment: Some of the articles and even the claims/arguments don\'t always load. Sometimes an argument/claim including the linked article and then if you explore another claim/argument (which often doesn\'t load) you loose the article or the claim/argument you were previously looking at.  Talk Origins is such a good resource. If it worked well for me on my device I\'d probably give it 4 or 5 stars out of 5. Unfortunately I\'ll have to uninstall it for now.  Please fix.
reviews.author: Steven Schneider

reviews.title: Interesting
reviews.comment: Great, to bad creationists won\'t listen to any evidence.  :/
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Waste of space...
reviews.comment: \"Problem fetching HTML\'\'..... it does it every time. Uninstalling.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice ideas but app useless
reviews.comment: The idea has merit. Unfortunately the app doesn\'t work. I can browse topics but not read articles. I\'m on a ZTE Warp and getting the fetching HTML error just as many are.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: HTML errors
reviews.comment: The organization is undeniably brilliant, but the articles themselves will not display. Instead it says \"Problem fetching HTML.\" Please fix this soon. Samsung Galaxy Player 5.0
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Need more like this on the Market!

reviews.title: Problem fetching HTML
reviews.comment: Could be great, but I can\'t access anything.

reviews.comment: Great app! I\'ve got a lot of reading to do. Excellent organization and clean presentation in the app. Great job.
